sentence.Network_en: Other than blowing up a tyre I hadn't done any car maintenance.
sentence.Network_cn: 除了给轮胎充气外，我没做过任何汽车保养。

sentence.Network_en: His car rolled over after a tyre was punctured.
sentence.Network_cn: 一只轮胎被扎破后，他的车翻了个底朝天。

sentence.Network_cn: 一辆货车爆胎了，向他们猛撞了过去。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (denoting the curved pieces of iron plate with which carriage wheels were formerly shod): perhaps a variant of archaic tire, shortening of attire (because the tyre was the ‘clothing’ of the wheel)

entry.def: A tyre is a thick piece of rubber which is fitted onto the wheels of vehicles such as cars, buses, and bicycles.

sentences.sentence: "automobile tires are usually made of rubber and filled with compressed air"
